p: Comparing to the prevalence found in other European countries, the values obtained in the wild boar in the present study are higher than those reported in the Czech Republic (4.1% ) [ 17], similar to that reported in France in 2009–2014 (5.6% for Flavivirus and 3.4% for USUV) [ 26, 27, 28, 29, 30, 31, 32, 33, 34], but are lower than those reported in Spain, with a mean prevalence of 12.6% but with a significantly higher seroprevalence (27%) in wetland habitats during 2006–2010 [ 19], and in Serbia by [ 34] (17.6% WNV prevalence). In this study, only four wild boar sera showed USUV specificity.
